Class Container.LogStreams

java.lang.Object
com.github.cowwoc.docker.resource.Container.LogStreams
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
Enclosing class:
Container
public static final class Container.LogStreams extends Object implements AutoCloseable
A container's log streams.

  • Constructor Details

    • LogStreams

      public LogStreams(InputStream stdout, InputStream stderr, org.eclipse.jetty.client.Request request)
      Creates a new instance.
      Parameters:
      stdout - the container's standard output stream, or null if not captured
      stderr - the container's standard error stream, or null if not captured (or included as part of stdout)
      request - the client request, or null if none of the streams were captured

  • Method Details

    • getStdout

      public InputStream getStdout()
      Returns the container's standard output stream.
      Returns:
      null if the stream was not captured

    • getStderr

      public InputStream getStderr()
      Returns the container's standard error stream.
      Returns:
      null if the stream was not captured

    • getExceptions

      public BlockingQueue<Throwable> getExceptions()
      Returns the errors encountered during the operation. Errors are added asynchronously as they occur. No new errors will be added after stopCapturing() is invoked.
      Returns:
      the errors
      See Also:
      • stopCapturing()

    • stopCapturing

      public void stopCapturing() throws InterruptedException
      Stops capturing the streams.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted before the request is aborted

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Stops capturing the streams.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      IOException - if any of the streams throw an IOException while closing
